workflow.name: Automatically monitor competitor pricing with Bright Data MCP & Google Sheets
workflow.description:
This workflow automatically monitors competitor pricing across multiple products and services to track market positioning and pricing strategies. It saves you time by eliminating the need to manually check competitor prices and provides real-time insights into pricing changes and market trends.

## Overview

This workflow automatically scrapes competitor websites and pricing pages to extract current pricing information, product details, and promotional offers. It uses Bright Data to access pricing data without restrictions and AI to intelligently parse pricing information and detect changes over time.

## Tools Used

- **n8n**: The automation platform that orchestrates the workflow
- **Bright Data**: For scraping competitor pricing pages without being blocked
- **OpenAI**: AI agent for intelligent pricing data extraction and analysis
- **Google Sheets**: For storing pricing data and tracking changes over time

## How to Install

1. **Import the Workflow**: Download the .json file and import it into your n8n instance
2. **Configure Bright Data**: Add your Bright Data credentials to the MCP Client node
3. **Set Up OpenAI**: Configure your OpenAI API credentials
4. **Configure Google Sheets**: Connect your Google Sheets account and set up your pricing tracking spreadsheet
5. **Customize**: Define competitor URLs and pricing monitoring parameters

## Use Cases

- **Pricing Strategy**: Stay competitive by monitoring market pricing trends
- **Product Management**: Track competitor feature and pricing changes
- **Sales Teams**: Provide up-to-date competitive pricing information
- **Market Research**: Analyze pricing patterns and market positioning

## Connect with Me

- **Website**: https://www.nofluff.online
- **YouTube**: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
- **LinkedIn**: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
- **Get Bright Data**: https://get.brightdata.com/1tndi4600b25 (Using this link supports my free workflows with a small commission)

#n8n #automation #pricemonitoring #competitorpricing #brightdata #webscraping #pricinganalysis #n8nworkflow #workflow #nocode #competitoranalysis #pricingdata #marketresearch #pricingtrends #competitiveintelligence #pricingtracking #marketanalysis #pricecomparison #competitormonitoring #businessintelligence #pricingstrategy #marketpositioning #pricinginsights #competitorresearch #pricingautomation #markettrends #pricealerts #dynamicpricing #pricingoptimization #competitivepricing

parameters.subject: Competitor product pricing has just logged into google sheets

nodes.name: üìÑ Save to Google Sheets (Competitor Pricing Log)

parameters.content:
### üîπ **Section 1: Schedule & Input Configuration**

#### üß© Nodes:

* `üìÖ Run Daily Check` *(Schedule Trigger)*
* `üõí Product Page URL` *(Edit Fields)*

#### üîç **What‚Äôs Happening?**

This section **starts the workflow** at a scheduled time ‚Äî daily, weekly, or hourly depending on your setup.
Then, the `Edit Fields` node optionally allows you to **manually enter or override** the product URL(s) to track. This makes your workflow flexible.

#### üí° **Beginner Tips:**

* Use `Edit Fields` when you want to quickly test a new product without changing the backend.
* Use the schedule to **automate price checks daily**, saving manual effort.

---

### ü§ñ **Section 2: Competitor Price Scraping via Agent**

#### üß© Nodes:

* `ü§ñ Scrape Competitor Prices (MCP Agent)`
* üåê `MCP Client`
* üí¨ `OpenAI Chat Model`
* üß© `Structured Output Parser`

#### üîç **What‚Äôs Happening?**

This is the **core engine** of the workflow. It uses an AI-powered agent connected to **Bright Data‚Äôs MCP (Mobile Carrier Proxy)** to:

1. Access dynamic websites like Nike.
2. Scrape product data even if the content loads via JavaScript.
3. Use OpenAI to intelligently plan scraping steps (optional).
4. Parse the messy data into **structured JSON** (via the parser).

#### üí° **Beginner Tips:**

* **Bright Data MCP** handles anti-bot tech on complex sites.
* No coding needed ‚Äî the agent knows how to fetch prices, descriptions, and links.

---

### üìß **Section 3: Email Notification**

#### üß© Node:

* `üìß Notify: Prices Logged in Sheet` *(Gmail)*

#### üîç **What‚Äôs Happening?**

Once the data is successfully scraped, this node **sends an email notification** to let you (or your team) know that competitor prices are now stored in Google Sheets.

The email could say something like:

> ‚úÖ ‚ÄúNew competitor pricing data has been added to the sheet. Click here to review.‚Äù

#### üí° **Beginner Tips:**

* You‚Äôll always stay **in the loop** ‚Äî no need to check the sheet manually.
* You can customize this email (add buttons, links, summaries, etc.).

---

### üìÑ **Section 4: Data Transformation & Storage**

#### üß© Nodes:

* `üßπ Format Products for Google Sheets` *(Code)*
* `üìÑ Save to Google Sheets (Competitor Pricing Log)` *(Google Sheets)*

#### üîç **What‚Äôs Happening?**

This final section processes the raw data and **converts it into individual product rows** so that Google Sheets can store each one neatly.

The Code node:

* Breaks the product list into single entries
* Extracts: name, price, description, URL

Then the Google Sheets node:

* Appends each product to a **new row** in your sheet (like a live price tracker)

#### üí° **Beginner Tips:**

* View trends over time in the sheet üìä
* Filter or sort based on price changes
* Use Google Sheets charts for visuals!

---

## I‚Äôll receive a tiny commission if you join Bright Data through this link‚Äîthanks for fueling more free content!

### https://get.brightdata.com/1tndi4600b25

=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================
For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
   - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
=======================================

## üíº Workflow Title: **Competitor Price Tracker & Logger**

> üìå This n8n automation regularly scrapes product prices from competitor websites (like Nike), stores the results in Google Sheets, and alerts you via email when new data is logged.

---

### üîπ **Section 1: Schedule & Input Configuration**

#### üß© Nodes:

* `üìÖ Run Daily Check` *(Schedule Trigger)*
* `üõí Product Page URL` *(Edit Fields)*

#### üîç **What‚Äôs Happening?**

This section **starts the workflow** at a scheduled time ‚Äî daily, weekly, or hourly depending on your setup.
Then, the `Edit Fields` node optionally allows you to **manually enter or override** the product URL(s) to track. This makes your workflow flexible.

#### üí° **Beginner Tips:**

* Use `Edit Fields` when you want to quickly test a new product without changing the backend.
* Use the schedule to **automate price checks daily**, saving manual effort.

---

### ü§ñ **Section 2: Competitor Price Scraping via Agent**

#### üß© Nodes:

* `ü§ñ Scrape Competitor Prices (MCP Agent)`
* üåê `MCP Client`
* üí¨ `OpenAI Chat Model`
* üß© `Structured Output Parser`

#### üîç **What‚Äôs Happening?**

This is the **core engine** of the workflow. It uses an AI-powered agent connected to **Bright Data‚Äôs MCP (Mobile Carrier Proxy)** to:

1. Access dynamic websites like Nike.
2. Scrape product data even if the content loads via JavaScript.
3. Use OpenAI to intelligently plan scraping steps (optional).
4. Parse the messy data into **structured JSON** (via the parser).

#### üí° **Beginner Tips:**

* **Bright Data MCP** handles anti-bot tech on complex sites.
* No coding needed ‚Äî the agent knows how to fetch prices, descriptions, and links.

---

### üìß **Section 3: Email Notification**

#### üß© Node:

* `üìß Notify: Prices Logged in Sheet` *(Gmail)*

#### üîç **What‚Äôs Happening?**

Once the data is successfully scraped, this node **sends an email notification** to let you (or your team) know that competitor prices are now stored in Google Sheets.

The email could say something like:

> ‚úÖ ‚ÄúNew competitor pricing data has been added to the sheet. Click here to review.‚Äù

#### üí° **Beginner Tips:**

* You‚Äôll always stay **in the loop** ‚Äî no need to check the sheet manually.
* You can customize this email (add buttons, links, summaries, etc.).

---

### üìÑ **Section 4: Data Transformation & Storage**

#### üß© Nodes:

* `üßπ Format Products for Google Sheets` *(Code)*
* `üìÑ Save to Google Sheets (Competitor Pricing Log)` *(Google Sheets)*

#### üîç **What‚Äôs Happening?**

This final section processes the raw data and **converts it into individual product rows** so that Google Sheets can store each one neatly.

The Code node:

* Breaks the product list into single entries
* Extracts: name, price, description, URL

Then the Google Sheets node:

* Appends each product to a **new row** in your sheet (like a live price tracker)

#### üí° **Beginner Tips:**

* View trends over time in the sheet üìä
* Filter or sort based on price changes
* Use Google Sheets charts for visuals!

---

## üß† Summary for Beginners

| Step | Purpose                              | Benefit                                                  |
| ---- | ------------------------------------ | -------------------------------------------------------- |
| 1Ô∏è‚É£  | Trigger & Input                      | Controls when to run and what products to track          |
| 2Ô∏è‚É£  | Scraping Agent                       | Collects competitor prices from hard-to-scrape websites  |
| 3Ô∏è‚É£  | Email Notification                   | Keeps you informed every time new data is captured       |
| 4Ô∏è‚É£  | Processing & Storing to Google Sheet | Stores clean data for review, tracking, or price updates |

---
